channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Checkpoints up to keep 'unauthorized' Metro Manila tourists out of Tagaytay
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: The task force said that setting up these checkpoints "is essential to ensure that those coming from GCQ areas, particularly from Metro Manila, would not be able to enter Cavite without a travel authority."

item.title: Cayetano: European Parliament reso on ABS-CBN franchise, Ressa cases is interference
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: Cayetano, a former foreign affairs secretary, said that the Philippines does not comment on policies in Europe like allowing abortion and that the EP's resolution was an intrusion on a domestic issue.

item.title: Agencies urged: Take advantage of extended state of calamity
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go urged all government agencies to use the one-year extension of the state of calamity to reexamine capabilities and improve the response against the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: BuCor spokesman tests positive for COVID-19
item.author: Ralph Edwin Villanueva
item.description: The spokesman of the Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) has tested positive for COVID-19, the bureau said yesterday.

item.title: Lawmakers clash over budget as speakership change nears
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: A word war has erupted over the 2021 national budget between congressmen linked to the two leaders of the House of Representatives, whose roles are set to switch in October under a term-sharing agreement of the speakership.

item.title: Senators to give Duterte authority vs red tape
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Senators have agreed to vest emergency powers on President Duterte to cut red-tape and stem corruption in order to speed up the issuance of business permits, without having to amend the Ease of Doing Business law, it was revealed yesterday.

item.title: Fuel prices to rise this week
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Oil companies are expected to implement increases in the prices of fuel this week.

item.title: LGUs can still use calamity funds vs COVID-19
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Local government units can continue using calamity funds to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Duterte keeps 1-meter distancing rule
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The one-meter physical distancing rule in public transportation remains, Malacañang said yesterday, ending the debate over the extent of easing quarantine restrictions as the government gradually reopens the economy.

item.title: Top broadcasters to train teachers
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Leading broadcast journalists will take part in a training program for teachers involved in the production of educational materials for the upcoming school year.
